Peyton Manning 's footwork lesson that shaped Fernando Mendoza's NFL future

Fernando Mendoza knows what it feels like to have everything go right. At first, Indiana went undefeated and won the Heisman Trophy. Plus, he sealed the national title with a fearless leap into the end zone against Miami, the hometown program that once overlooked him. It looked like the perfect ending, the kind built for documentaries and highlight reels.Now the lights feel different. The NFL does not care about college glory, and Mendoza understands that better than most. As the projected No. 1 pick prepares for the April 23, 2026, draft in Pittsburgh, he keeps replaying a moment where praise never came. Instead, a Hall of Fame quarterback stopped him mid-celebration and pointed out something small that could have ruined everything at the next level.Speaking with Andrew Cheroff, Fernando Mendoza shared a lesson from HOF Peyton Manning while he was at the Manning Passing Academy. He was learning to operate under center after years in spread offenses. He fired a strong pass and felt proud of the result. Peyton Manning was watching him and saw a problem.“I was feeling good because I just threw a great ball in front of a Hall of Fame quarterback,” Mendoza said in the online interview. “And he rips into me. He’s like, ‘That’s the wrong footwork!’”That moment stuck. Mendoza said the coach broke down every step and explained how poor mechanics lead to sacks, tipped passes, and interceptions in the NFL.Mendoza said in the same interview, “And I think that the advice, especially with play-action, and how that translates to the NFL, and how that translated to the Indiana offense, always struck with me because it says, ‘Okay, yeah, you’ve made a good throw, but the throw won’t be there if the defenders don’t come up and get attracted to the run.’The star-QB further elaborated how the lesson helped him: “At this point in the NFL, everyone can make the throws,” Mendoza said in the same interview. “It’s about the fine details. That’s what makes the great ones great. It’s the fine details.”That focus on details defined his season at Indiana. Mendoza played efficient football and protected the ball. He entered the College Football Playoff title game with more TD passes than incompletions, a number that helped cement his rise to the top of draft boards. The championship leap made Mendoza famous. The footwork correction may define his future. As draft night approaches, he is trusting that discipline and precision will carry him further than any highlight ever could.
Article Summary: Fernando Mendoza is the projected No. 1 pick in the 2026 NFL draft. He won the Heisman Trophy and sealed the national title with a fearless leap into the end zone against Miami, the hometown program that once overlooked him. The NFL does not care about college glory.

Article Title: Joe Burrow and Kendall Jenner dating rumors go viral after playful Instagram post sparks social media frenzy: But is it real?

Why the Joe Burrow and Kendall Jenner dating rumors are false



Rumors linking Cincinnati Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow and model Kendall Jenner have taken social media by storm, igniting debates among fans and followers. The frenzy began after a doctored Instagram photo appeared to show Jenner and Burrow dining together, though experts and multiple reports have confirmed it’s entirely fabricated. The story quickly spread across platforms, with speculation fueled by Jenner’s recent Super Bowl ad for Fanatics Sportsbook.In the ad, Jenner pokes fun at her history of dating NBA players and hints at trying football for a change. “Any basketball player who dates me kind of hits a rough patch,” she says. “While the world’s been talking about it, I’ve been betting on it. How else do you think I can afford all this… modeling?” She adds, “But today, it’s time to bet on something new. Football players.” This playful commentary, combined with her orange-and-black Tonight Show outfit, triggered a wave of rumors connecting her to Burrow.The viral photo of Kendall Jenner apparently across a dinner table from Joe Burrow is a complete fabrication, likely generated with AI. Close inspection reveals inconsistencies, including a bizarre dish on Burrow’s plate and timing anomalies suggesting the screenshot was manipulated immediately after posting.TMZ and other sources confirmed that the Instagram Stories allegedly showing the pair never existed.Burrow, 26, keeps his personal life private and has been linked to model Olivia Ponton since mid-2025 after breaking up with longtime girlfriend Olivia Holzmacher. Meanwhile, Jenner, 30, has an extensive history of dating NBA players like Devin Booker, Blake Griffin, and Ben Simmons, which made the football angle a humorous marketing twist rather than fact. Fans misinterpreted her recent public appearances and ad campaign as confirmation, but neither Burrow nor Jenner has commented on the speculation.The episode highlights how quickly AI-generated images and viral posts can blur the lines between reality and fiction. For fans, it’s a reminder that online rumors- even involving high-profile celebrities- require careful scrutiny before being believed.
Article Summary: The viral photo of Kendall Jenner apparently across a dinner table from Joe Burrow is a complete fabrication, likely generated with AI. Close inspection reveals inconsistencies, including a bizarre dish on Burrow’s plate and timing anomalies suggesting the screenshot was manipulated immediately after posting.

Article Title: Myles Garrett’s relationship history with Chloe Kim: How the NFL star and Olympic champion first met?

First meeting in Tokyo sparks rumors

Support at Browns games makes it official

Both couple supporting each other

The public support showed that their relationship extends beyond red carpet appearances.Kim, meanwhile, continues training for the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics, where she hopes to win a third consecutive halfpipe gold medal.Both athletes are at the top of their respective sports. Article Title: Paul Allen Estate shuts down speculation the Seahawks could be sold following Super Bowl LX
Article Text:
Seahawks up for sale after Super Bowl? (Getty Images)

Seattle Seahawks sale rumors spark sharp response from Paul Allen Estate



The Seattle Seahawks sale rumors made headlines on Friday, raising urgent questions about the franchise’s ownership future just days before Super Bowl LX. ESPN reported that the Seahawks could be put up for sale after the season, a claim that instantly reverberated across the NFL and the Pacific Northwest. Given the team’s estimated valuation of $7 to $8 billion, the timing and implications could not be bigger.What followed was swift and pointed resistance from the Paul G. Allen Estate. While Paul Allen’s will clearly mandates the eventual sale of his major assets, including the Seahawks, the estate insists the process is not imminent. With championship ambitions still alive and another major sale already underway, the estate says its priorities lie elsewhere for now.The report from ESPN’s Seth Wickersham and Brady Henderson suggested the Seahawks would be placed on the market shortly after Super Bowl LX, scheduled for Feb. 8. The Wall Street Journal later added weight to that claim, citing people familiar with the matter who believe a sale process could begin once the season ends.The Allen Estate pushed back hard. A spokesperson issued a clear statement Friday afternoon: “We don’t comment on rumors or speculation, and the team is not for sale.We’ve already said that will change at some point per Paul’s wishes, but I have no news to share. Our focus right now is winning the Super Bowl and completing the sale of (Allen’s NBA) Portland Trail Blazers in the coming months.”That context matters. The Trail Blazers entered a formal sales process in September 2025 and are expected to fetch up to $4.25 billion. Completing that transaction alone is a massive undertaking. Estate officials have previously acknowledged that selling Allen’s assets could take 10 to 20 years, not months.Still, the questions linger. Allen bought the Seahawks in 1997 for $200 million and oversaw the most successful era in franchise history. The team plays at Lumen Field under a lease that runs through 2031, with extension options stretching decades beyond. Jody Allen, now chair of the franchise, recently lifted the George Halas Trophy on the Lumen Field stage, a powerful reminder of continuity amid uncertainty.Whether a sale begins after Super Bowl LX or years from now, one fact is settled. The Seahawks will eventually change hands. When that moment arrives, it will mark the end of an ownership era that reshaped football in Seattle.
Article Summary: ESPN reported that the Seahawks could be put up for sale after the season. The team's estimated valuation is $7 to $8 billion. The Paul G. Allen Estate insists the process is not imminent. With championship ambitions still alive, the estate says its priorities lie elsewhere.
